name: Embassy Office Parks REIT
about: Embassy REIT is India’s first publicly listed Real Estate Investment Trust. Embassy REIT owns and operates a 42.4 million square feet (“msf”) portfolio of eight infrastructure-like office parks and four city‑centre office buildings in India’s best-performing office markets of Bengaluru, Mumbai, Pune, and the National Capital Region (“NCR”).
pros: Company has been maintaining a healthy dividend payout.
cons: Promoter holding has decreased over last quarter

name: Mindspace Business Parks REIT
about: Mindspace Business Parks REIT (“Mindspace REIT”) offers a gateway to one of the largest, Grade A Office portfolios in India. We have a well-diversified portfolio of business and IT parks spread across the key commercial markets of Mumbai, Hyderabad, Pune and Chennai.
cons: gave lower capital gains in a year

name: IRB InvIT Fund
about: IRB InvIT Fund (the Trust) is an irrevocable trust set up under the Indian Trusts Act, 1882, and registered with the Securities and Exchange Board of India as an infrastructure investment trust under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Infrastructure Investment Trusts) Regulations, 2014 (Registration Number: IN/InvIT/15-16/0001).
pros: Stock is trading at 0.75 times its book value

name: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust REIT
about: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust REIT is an India-based commercial real estate vehicle. The Company's portfolio consists of campus-format office parks. Its commercial assets are located in Mumbai, Gurgaon, Noida and Kolkata
pros: Stock not in ASM/GSM lists and not a lot of promoter holding is pledged

name: POWERGRID Infrastructure Investment Trust
about: Power Grid Corporation of India Limited, is an Indian government electricity board and a Maharatna Public Sector Undertaking owned by Ministry of Power, Government of India and is headquartered in Gurugram.
pros: Company has been maintaining a healthy dividend payout
not a lot of promoter holding is pledged
